title: Quiz 4: Occupational Health Services
description: Assess knowledge of workplace hazards, prevention strategies, and the occupational health nurse's role.

questions.question: What is the definition of 'Occupational Hazard'?

options.text: A condition of a job that can result in illness or injury.
A salary bonus for dangerous work.

questions.explanation: An occupational hazard is any condition of a job that can result in illness or injury, or a source of danger.
questions.hint: It relates to danger or risk at work.

questions.question: Classify the following occupational hazards:
questions.explanation: Physical (noise, heat), Chemical (dust, fumes), Biological (bacteria, viruses), Psychosocial (stress).
questions.hint: Anthrax is a living organism; Noise is a physical force.

questions.question: Which of the following are objectives of a 'Preplacement Examination'?

options.text: Determine suitability for a particular job
Provide a baseline record for future comparison

questions.explanation: Preplacement exams aim to match the worker to the job, find existing conditions, and set a health baseline.
questions.hint: It happens before they start working to ensure fitness.

questions.question: Rank the methods of dealing with hazards from MOST effective to LEAST effective (based on general principles implies in the text):
questions.explanation: Elimination is best. Engineering controls (ventilation) are next. PPE is often the least effective because it relies on worker compliance.
questions.hint: Getting rid of the danger is better than just wearing a mask.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ role of an occupational health nurse involves periodically assessing the workplace for lighting, ventilation, and humidity.
questions.explanation: The Environmental Role involves assessing external conditions like lighting and ventilation.
questions.hint: It relates to the surroundings of the worker.

questions.question: Primary prevention in occupational health is only concerned with treating wounds and cuts after they happen.
questions.explanation: Primary prevention anticipates problems and tries to AVOID them before they occur (e.g., good machine construction, training). Treating wounds is tertiary prevention.

questions.question: Which of the following is a 'Psychosocial Hazard'?
questions.explanation: Critical incident stress is a psychosocial hazard affecting mental well-being. The others are Biological, Physical, and Chemical respectively.
questions.hint: It affects the mind and emotions.

questions.question: What is the term for the combined effects of external conditions and influences prevailing at the place of work?
questions.explanation: Occupational environment is the combined effects of external conditions and influences at work.

questions.question: Why is 'General Ventilation' important in the workplace?

options.text: To remove atmospheric contaminants and heat.
To allow workers to look outside.

questions.explanation: Ventilation removes dust, fumes, and heat, improving the working environment.

questions.question: Which agents does a worker interact with in an industrial setting? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Workers interact with agents (physical/chem/bio), machinery/electricity, and other people.
questions.hint: Consider the environment, the tools, and the people.
